H0.text: Long ears are the trait most likely to help an animal survive in a very cold environment.

H1.text: Large eyes are the trait most likely to help an animal survive in a very cold environment.

H2.text: Thick fur is the trait that most likely helps an animal survive in a very cold environment.

H3.text: Sharp claws are the trait most likely to help an animal survive in a very cold environment.

A4.text: The denseness of fur can increase an animal's insulation value, and arctic mammals especially have dense fur

A5.text: The muskox has guard hairs measuring 30 cm (12 in) as well as a dense underfur, which forms an airtight coat, allowing them to survive in temperatures of −40 °C (−40 °F)
